text: The 2018 ABC Supply 500 was the 14th round of the 2018 IndyCar Series season. The race was held on August 19 at Pocono Raceway in Long Pond, Pennsylvania. The race served as the 14th round of the 2018 IndyCar Series season. 2018 Indy 500 champion Will Power qualified on pole position, while 2016 Indy 500 champion Alexander Rossi took victory in the 200-lap race. The race was marred by a massive crash on lap 6 which ended the races of Ryan Hunter-Reay, Robert Wickens, James Hinchcliffe, Takuma Sato, and Pietro Fittipaldi. Hunter-Reay, Hinchcliffe, Sato, and Fittipaldi were unharmed, but Wickens sustained severe injuries and was paralyzed from the chest down as a result. == Results == {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 95%;" !Key !Meaning |- | align="center" |R |Rookie |- | align="center" |W |Past winner |} === Qualifying === {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; font-size: 95%;" !Pos !No. !Name !Lap 1 Time !Lap 2 Time !Total Time !Avg.
